author: James Martin
method: Heat the sugar and water in a saucepan until the sugar melts and the mixture resembles a syrup. Melt the chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water. (Do not lot the base of the bowl touch the water.) Stir in the golden syrup and enough sugar syrup to form a smooth sauce. (Caution: the chocolate mixture will be very hot, allow to cool a little before serving.) Serve with the platter of fruit.
ingredients: 110g/4oz sugar,  110ml4fl oz water,  400g/14oz plain chocolate, broken in pieces,  2 tbsp golden syrup,  selection of fruits cut in bite-sized pieces such as orange, banana, grapes, dates or pineapple.
